Text.Page: Keezar claimed that his special glue could stick destroyed clues back together. Many materials were needed to produce the glue, but ultimately you were successful in reconstructing the clue.

As you've no doubt guessed, glue doesn't just grow on trees, unless you're talking sap, and if you were talking sap, I'd be crazy to be talking to you.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"I'm not talking sap!"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

So you're talking glue. Got it.

Well, we're going to need lime for this glue to work—the mineral kind, not the stuff you had in the hold of the sky cruiser to ward off scurvy. There's plenty of lime deposits around the hot springs here behind me—that is, if your popori friend hasn't scooped them all up already for his muscle relaxant.

Bring me lime, ."Sky...? Popori...? Lime! Right, I'll get some lime."

That wasn't such a chore, now, was it?

But putting the pendant back together is the easy part. It still needs to be attuned to the demokron talismans for it to work. I'll need you to kill Parthian bowmen, Parthian warriors, and Parthian riders to collect mysterious talismans..."Like these?"

You already had them before you came to see me?

My, oh my! It's been so long, I forgot what it was like to work with professionals!

Now wait right there while I perform this extremely delicate and complicated procedure..."Okay."
Hot springs are right behind me. Big white thingies, with big blue thingies in the middle?

How long will what take? I told you: I need deva horns!

I can't deal with you when you're like this. I don't even know who you are anymore. You're not the person I fell in love with. I really need to focus on my career right now.

Why don't you go talk to my production assistant, Dandit? He's just down the road to the south.

Yes, he'll validate you."Okay."

Keezar sent you?

That's...strange. She's not the kind of person who helps others...

Well, let's see why she sent you to me."Keezar was going to fix this pendant for me..."

Hmm. She did most of the work. The glue just needs Spirit's Tear.

Fortunately, Spirit's Tear isn't hard to find. Parthian War-Shamans carry it, and as luck would have it there's a group of them behind me here, up on the hill."Okay..."

Nicely done.

Mixing the lime and the Spirit's Tear holds the pendant's pieces together and focuses the magic.

Shouldn't take but a few seconds."Sure."
Without the Spirit's Tear, the lime is just a chalky mineral.

You're good to go.

Make sure you've got all of the pendant pieces out of your pack, then stick them together with the power glue."Thank you."

Let me see it.

Yes, it's functioning properly again. But it's best that you don't try to activate it, unless you want it to shatter again.

By the way, those people over there by the teleport platform were looking for you earlier. Friends of yours?"I'll figure it out, thanks."
